admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
trustfund: TF020090-BELGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF021936-OTF - TUNISIA ODS PHASEOUT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Phaseout of Ozone
            Depleting Substances (ODS) Project are to: 1) establish the
            institutional and regulatory framework for decreasing ODS
            uses; and 2) introduce ODS-free technologies to the
            refrigeration, foam and aerosol industries as a first
            demonstration phase in completing an early ODS phaseout
            program. The project consists of two main components
            involving institutional strengthening and technology
            transfer. The technology development component includes the
            following: 1) in the refrigeration sector, introduction of
            hydrofluorocarbon 134a (HFC-134a) as a refrigerant replacing
            chlorofluorocarbon 12 (CFC-12), replacement of CFC-11 as a
            foam-blowing agent by a low CFC and/or non-CFC substance,
            and the introduction of a CFC-recycling and refrigeration
            maintenance program to train refrigeration technicians how
            to recycle CFCs and handle non-ODS refrigerants; 2) flexible
            foam which will demonstrate the replacement of CFC-11 with a
            non-ODS substitute; and 3) an aerosol component which will
            consist of a sectoral study in order to determine the full
            technical and financial needs for technology development.
            Finally, the institutional strengthening component will
            consist of establishing the Ozone Project Implementation
            Unit which will be responsible for execution of the project.
